title_full: MNAPER01-BP01 Understand the available services and resources
title: Understand the available services and resources
description: Explore the wide range of services and resources available in the cloud. Identify the relevant services and configuration options for your workload, and determine how to achieve optimal performance.

title_full: MNAPER01-BP02 Define a process for architectural choices
title: Define a process for architectural choices
description: Define a process to choose resources and services by using internal experience and knowledge of the cloud or external resources such as published use cases, relevant documentation, or whitepapers. You should define a process that encourages experimentation and benchmarking with any services that could be used in your workload.

title_full: MNAPER01-BP03 Factor cost requirements into decisions
title: Factor cost requirements into decisions
description: Workloads often have cost requirements for operation. Use internal cost controls to select resource types and sizes based on predicted resource need.

title_full: MNAPER01-BP04 Use guidance from your cloud provider or an appropriate partner
title: Use guidance from your cloud provider or an appropriate partner
description: Use cloud company resources, such as solutions architects, professional services, or an appropriate partner to guide your decisions. These resources can help review and improve your architecture for optimal performance.

title_full: MNAPER01-BP05 Benchmark workloads from both organization
title: Benchmark workloads from both organization
description: Benchmark the performance of an existing workload to understand how it performs in the cloud. Use the data collected from benchmarks to make architectural decisions.

title_full: MNAPER02-BP01 Scale current architecture and hosting through manual or automatic means
title: Scale current architecture and hosting through manual or automatic means
description: Take progressive steps to achieve scaling.

title_full: MNAPER02-BP02 Remediate bottlenecks that prevent scaling, and use automatic scaling or serverless resources when appropriate
title: Remediate bottlenecks that prevent scaling, and use automatic scaling or serverless resources when appropriate
description: Serverless technologies feature automatic scaling, built-in high availability, and a pay-for-use billing model to increase agility. Serverless technologies reduce infrastructure management tasks like capacity provisioning. For more detail, see Serverless on AWS.

title_full: MNAPER02-BP03 Perform periodic static provisioning for peak usage in reaction to monitoring data
title: Perform periodic static provisioning for peak usage in reaction to monitoring data
description: Review historical data to understand peak usage days and time. Manually pre-provision resources based on historical data findings.

title_full: MNAPER02-BP04 Rearchitect to scale for new customers
title: Rearchitect to scale for new customers
description: Cloud solutions architects should ideally build an architecture with the future in mind, meaning their solutions need to cater to current scale requirements as well as the anticipated growth of the solution. This growth can be either the organic growth of a solution, or it could be related to a merger and acquisition scenario where its size is increased dramatically within a short period of time.
